text.p: - Unofficial Paris welcomed Russia's former security chief Alexander Lebed. But the French political establishment remains loyal to President Yeltsin.
- After regional elections in Russia, local elites wish to regain some assets owned by central authorities in Moscow.
- The new tax code which is going to be discussed at the Russian government meeting on Thursday, is likely to determine the future of the present cabinet.
- Anti-dumping measures taken against Russian metal exports on foreign markets will have a negative impact on the Russian economy and social spheres.

- For the second time this century, Western democracy is facing a strategic choice -- whether to incorporate or exclude Russia from its ranks, says Boris Berezovsky. The business magnate and deputy secretary of the Kremlin Security Council analyses the problems of NATO's planned eastward expansion.
- The new tax code which presupposes a significant reduction in tax breaks, if adopted, will bring 70 trillion roubles into the state budget.

- The most influential representatives of the first generation of Russian bankers has given up banking for apparently less profitable political carriers to secure their position among the country's elite.
- Having lost the superpower status that Soviet Union enjoyed, Russia can only count on being respected as an important international player by "third-rate countries", the paper says.
